description: TEHRAN – The Cinematheque of the Iranian Artists Forum (IAF) will screen American filmmaker Wes Anderson’s 2025 movie “The Phoenician Scheme” on Thursday.
title: IAF to review “The Phoenician Scheme”

description: TEHRAN – “The Toilers of the Sea” by French writer Victor Hugo has been published in Persian by Hermes Publications.
title: “The Toilers of the Sea” comes to Iranian bookstores

description: TEHRAN – Iranian director Behruz Gharibpour is restaging the Ashura opera puppet show with his Aran Theater Troupe at Tehran’s Ferdowsi Hall to mark the month of Muharram.
title: Ashura opera puppet show returns to stage to commemorate Muharram

description: More than 700 Palestinians, mostly children, have been killed by Israeli army fire while collecting water since October 2023, local authorities said on Monday, according to Anadolu Agency.
title: Over 700 Palestinians killed while collecting water in Gaza

description: BEIRUT — Despite sparking widespread public and political outrage, Lebanese Forces leader Samir Geagea was quick to justify the threats made by the US envoy to Lebanon, Thomas Barrack, regarding Lebanon’s “concession” to Syria and its inclusion as part of the Levant.
title: Geagea capitalizing on US envoy’s threats that Lebanon may annex Lebanon

description: BEIRUT — Despite sparking widespread public and political outrage, Lebanese Forces leader Samir Geagea was quick to justify the threats made by the US envoy to Lebanon, Thomas Barrack, regarding Lebanon’s “concession” to Syria and its inclusion as part of the Levant.
title: Geagea Justifies US Envoy’s Threats on Annexing Lebanon to Syria

description: The Israeli army is weaponizing Chinese-made drones to kill Palestinian civilians in the Gaza Strip, according to an investigation by the Israeli publications 972 Magazine and the Local Call, Al Jazeera reported.
title: Gaza civilians killed with commercial drones, probe finds

description: Azerbaijan and Syria took steps toward restoring bilateral relations on 13 July, with both countries' leaders pledging enhanced cooperation, particularly in the energy sector, amid talks between Syrian and Israeli officials in the Azeri capital, according to Cradle.
title: Syria, Azerbaijan renew ties amid secret talks with Israel

description: The Boston Consulting Group (BCG) was paid over $1m for advising a private US maritime aid initiative for Gaza that operated outside the traditional United Nations-led system, according to the Financial Times.
title: BCG 'paid over $1m' for Gaza maritime aid project

description: TEHRAN - Javan discussed Europe's readiness to activate the snapback mechanism in an article.
title: The complexities of the snapback mechanism

description: TEHRAN — Iran will not reenter nuclear negotiations unless it is assured of diplomacy’s effectiveness, Foreign Ministry spokesman Esmail Baghaei said Monday, warning against politicizing the concept of dialogue and reaffirming Iran’s commitment to defending its national interests through both diplomatic and military means.
title: No return to talks without guarantee of diplomatic effectiveness: Iran foreign ministry

description: TEHRAN – The interior ministers of Iran, Iraq, and Pakistan convened in Tehran on Monday for a trilateral summit focused on coordinating security and logistical measures for the upcoming Arbaeen pilgrimage.
title: Iran, Iraq, Pakistan unite for Arbaeen amid regional solidarity against Israeli aggression

description: TEHRAN — Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi has said Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu failed to achieve any of his objectives in the regime’s recent war against Iran, yet is now attempting to dictate U.S. policy on Iran’s missile and nuclear programs.
title: Netanyahu failed to win war, now trying to control U.S. policy on Iran: Araghchi

description: TEHRAN – Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian has reaffirmed Iran’s commitment to diplomacy and national sovereignty in a message to Iranians living abroad following the 12-day war with the Israeli regime.
title: War not our choice, but surrender not an option: Pezeshkian to Iranian diaspora

description: TEHRAN – Iran’s Deputy Foreign Minister for Legal and International Affairs, Kazem Gharibabadi, condemned potential European efforts to trigger the snapback mechanism as an act of "utter audacity," warning that it would significantly curb talks with European counterparts and provoke proportional countermeasures.
title: European snapback bid would be ‘utter audacity,’ senior Iranian diplomat warns

description: TEHRAN – Head of Iran’s Martyrs and Veterans Affairs Foundation, Saeed Ohadi, confirmed on Monday that at least 1,062 people were killed during Israel’s 12-day military aggression against Iran, with 5,800 others wounded.
title: New figure says 1,062 martyred, 5,800 wounded in 12 days of Israeli aggression

description: TEHRAN — Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian met on Monday with several families affected by the recent Israeli aggression during a visit to a temporary shelter center in Tehran Province.
title: Pezeshkian visits families displaced by Israeli attacks, vows continued support

description: TEHRAN – Benjamin Netanyahu's five-day trip to the United States was marked by a series of eyebrow-raising pronouncements. From announcing that he will nominate Donald Trump for a Nobel Peace Prize to claiming he wants a “better future” for Palestinians after killing over 60,000 of them in cold blood, the Israeli Prime Minister delivered the kind of outlandish statements observers have now come to expect.
title: Bibi hangs onto ‘daddy’ over missile nightmare

description: Dr. Hussam Abu Safiya, the director of Kamal Adwan Hospital, is being held under extremely alarming conditions after being detained and taken to an Israeli prison in December following a brutal military campaign on the key Gaza hospital, Al Mayadeen reported.
title: Dr. Abu Safiya enduring severe abuse in Israeli prison

description: Former Israeli Prime Minister Ehud Olmert, in an interview with the Guardian on Monday, said that "Israel's" proposed "humanitarian city" in Rafah is tantamount to ethnic cleansing and would operate as a concentration camp if realized.
title: Rafah plan is ethnic cleansing disguised as aid: Olmert

description: NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte's visit to the White House came on the day that Trump promised to deliver a "major statement" on Russia, AFP reported.
title: Trump set to unveil Ukraine weapons plan at meeting with NATO chief

description: SHANGHAI - The last June witnessed one of the most flagrant aggressions against a sovereign nation state in its modern history and one of the largest military clashes in recent human history. National characters are always manifested in big events, and the following three, together with others, are particularly demonstrated in the 12-day war. A nation facing challenges, difficulties, and adversities could grow even stronger.
title: A nation grows stronger in adversities

description: TEHRAN - Since the outbreak of the Gaza war in October 2023, the Israeli military has been grappling with a surge in suicides among soldiers.
title: Suicides among Israeli soldiers expose systemic breakdown

description: TEHRAN – At least 37 people have been killed in the latest wave of sectarian violence in the war-torn Syria.
title: Dozens killed in sectarian violence in Syria

description: TEHRAN - Drinking vessels of varied designs flourished throughout the Near East from the 1st millennium BCE well into the Islamic era.
title: Echoes of the past: gold rhyton in the form of a winged lion

description: TEHRAN—Storm showed another part of Fahraj Spice Road. The Spice Road was one of Iran’s first ancient routes for trading spice to various parts of the world. It was connected to Silk Road. Some parts of it were exposed in the late 1990s due to a severe storm.
title: Storm shows another part of Fahraj Spice Road

description: TEHRAN—The Secretary of the Cabinet Seyyed Kamel Taqavi-Nejad said today, tourism is not only an industry but is one of the effective tools for Iran’s economic and cultural diplomacy.
title: Tourism, one of Iran's soft power tools in international interactions

description: TEHRAN—Reza Mousavi, a senior official of Hamedan province, said 224 Mookebs (service centers with a religious nature where Shia Muslims come together and conduct religious rituals during Arbaeen) have been launched across the province to render services to the pilgrims during Arbaeen.
title: 224 Hamedani Mookebs render services to Arbaeen pilgrims

description: TEHRAN - Professor John D. Speth, a distinguished anthropologist and emeritus faculty member at the University of Michigan, has warmly congratulated the recent inscription of the Paleolithic caves of Iran’s Khorramabad Valley on the UNESCO World Heritage List.
title: University of Michigan professor congratulates Iran on UNESCO designation of Paleolithic caves

description: TEHRAN - For Negin Rasoulipour Khameneh, the FIBA Women’s Asia Cup 2025 is more than just another tournament. It is a chance to rewrite history.
title: Negin Rasoulipour wants to rewrite history

description: TEHRAN - When 24-year-old Taiwanese traveler Ariel Kang Chengxuan went to bed on June 12 in Isfahan, Iran, she had no idea she was about to wake up in the midst of all-out war.
title: ‘I will never regret coming’: solo female traveler reflects amid Israel’s strikes on Iran

description: TEHRAN – According to the Vice President for Women and Family Affairs, Zahra Behrouz-Azar, women comprise 56 percent of academic communities in the country, holding over 60 percent of the staff working with schools, and 63 percent of university students.
title: Women account for 56% of academic communities: VP

description: TEHRAN – A total of 27,200 Iranians donated blood under a national campaign during Tasua and Ashura (the ninth and tenth days of the month of Muharram), according to Bashir Haji-Beigi, spokesman for the Blood Transfusion Organization.
title: Over 27,000 people donated blood on Tasua, Ashura

description: TEHRAN – From the beginning of the current water year (September 23, 2024) to July 12, precipitation across the country amounted to 136.3 mm, indicating a 39.7 percent decrease from the long-term average of 226.1 mm recorded in the same period, according to the Meteorological Organization.
title: Rainfall declines by almost 40%

description: TEHRAN – An Iranian team comprising six students placed second in the 3rd International Mathematics Summer Camp (IMSC) held in Beijing, China, from June 20 to July 12, 2025.
title: Iranian students rank 2nd in Intl. Mathematics Summer Camp

description: TEHRAN – President Masoud Pezeshkian has issued an order calling for the establishment of a specialized working group to address sand and dust storms (SDSs), which have turned into a significant public health concern in the country.
title: Ad hoc working group to deal with sand and dust storms

description: TEHRAN- The general manager of China State Railway Group Company, known as China Railway (CR), considered Iran an important partner in the "One Belt, One Road" initiative and emphasized the need for coordination to stabilize prices and facilitate customs processes in the Southern Corridor.
title: Iran an important partner in One Belt, One Road initiative: China Railway general manager

description: TEHRAN- The secretary of Iran’s Free and Special Economic Zones High Council said that during the 12 days of the imposed war, 118,000 tons of basic commodities were cleared from seven free zones, which was aimed at meeting the country's needs.
title: 118,000 tons of basic goods cleared from free zones in 12-day war

description: TEHRAN – Iran defeated Kazakhstan in straight sets (25-11, 25-16, 25-21) in the Asian Men’s U16 Volleyball Championship Thailand 2025 on Monday.
title: Iran earn third win in 2025 Asian U16 Volleyball Championship

description: TEHRAN- TEDPIX, the main index of the Tehran Stock Exchange (TSE), rose 26,489 points to 2.734 million on Monday, which is the third day of the Iranian calendar week.
title: TEDPIX gains 26,400 points on Monday

description: TEHRAN- Production of copper cathode in Iran increased by 1.7 percent in the past Iranian calendar year 1403 (ended on March 20), Tasnim news agency reported.
title: Annual copper cathode production increases 1.7%

description: TEHRAN- Solar power plants with the capacity of 11.5 megawatts (MW) were put into operation in Khorasan Razavi province, in the northeast of Iran, on Monday morning.
title: Solar power plants with capacity of 11.5 MW put into operation in Khorasan Razavi

description: TEHRAN- Solar power plants with the capacity of 5.11 megawatts (MW) were put into operation in Khorasan Razavi province, in the northeast of Iran, on Monday morning.
title: Solar power plants with capacity of 5.11 MW put into operation in Khorasan Razavi

description: TEHRAN – Branko Katic has been named as goalkeeping coach of Sepahan football club.
title: Katic named Sepahan goalkeeping coach
